sentence.text: In this study, we aimed to examine the expression of sodium ion transport in ovarian cancer and in normal ovarian tissues, its prognostic value and the possible mechanism of its dysregulation.
Results showed that sodium ion transport was upregulated in ovarian cancer compared with normal ovarian epithelial tissues.

In patients with primary serous ovarian cancer in TCGA-OV, the cases with lymphatic invasion (N = 133) had significantly higher sodium ion transport expression than those without lymphatic invasion (N = 77) (p = 0.0069).
320 out of 578 (55.4%) ovarian cancer cases had sodium ion transport amplification.
Based on these findings, we infer that high sodium ion transport expression is an independent predictor for poor OS in grade 3/4 serous ovarian cancer.
